alert.note: Alert for Carlton, South St. Louis; Southern Cook, North Shore; Southern Lake, North Shore (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued April 02 at 3:39PM CDT until April 06 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 9 inches and ice accumulations of one tenth to one quarter of an inch possible. Winds could gust as high as 65 mph. * WHERE...Southern Lake, Southern Cook and Carlton and South St. Louis Counties. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Grand Portage Reservation and the Fond du Lac Band. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Very strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines.
info.instruction: Prepare for possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Carlton, South St. Louis; Southern Cook, North Shore; Southern Lake, North Shore
